item.title: Medical Research, Health Care Face Deep Cuts In Trump Budget
item.description: May 23, 2017 - The administration's proposed budget would cut billions out of health programs at the NIH, CDC, and FDA, as well as Medicaid services for children, the elderly and disabled.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 23, 2017 - The administration's proposed budget would cut billions out of health programs at the NIH, CDC, and FDA, as well as Medicaid services for children, the elderly and disabled. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/23/529654114/medical-research-health-care-face-deep-cuts-in-trump-budget

item.title: GOP Bill Could Undercut Some Coverage In Job-Based Insurance
item.description: May 23, 2017 - If states opted to change so-called essential health benefits, as the current health care bill allows, out-of-pocket spending limits and caps on coverage in large group insurance plans could weaken.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 23, 2017 - If states opted to change so-called essential health benefits, as the current health care bill allows, out-of-pocket spending limits and caps on coverage in large group insurance plans could weaken. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/23/529565222/gop-bill-could-undercut-some-coverage-in-job-based-insurance

item.title: Nacho Cheese Sauce Tainted With Botulism Kills California Man
item.description: May 23, 2017 - An outbreak of botulism caused by nacho cheese sauce from a gas station has hospitalized nine people and killed one man in northern California.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 23, 2017 - An outbreak of botulism caused by nacho cheese sauce from a gas station has hospitalized nine people and killed one man in northern California. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/23/529589579/nacho-cheese-sauce-tainted-with-botulism-kills-california-man

item.title: Face-To-Face Sleep Education Plus 'Baby Boxes' Reduces Bed Sharing
item.description: May 22, 2017 - The two-pronged approach to promoting safe sleep led to a 25 percent drop in the risky practice of bed sharing with babies in the first eight days of life, a study found. But more research is needed.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 22, 2017 - The two-pronged approach to promoting safe sleep led to a 25 percent drop in the risky practice of bed sharing with babies in the first eight days of life, a study found. But more research is needed. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/22/529494944/face-to-face-sleep-education-plus-baby-boxes-reduces-bed-sharing

item.title: In Some Rural Counties, Hunger Is Rising, But Food Donations Aren't
item.description: May 22, 2017 - Pantries in southwest Virginia — where poverty is rampant and coal jobs are vanishing — will take whatever they can get to stock bare shelves. Some also offer help with health care and job training.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 22, 2017 - Pantries in southwest Virginia — where poverty is rampant and coal jobs are vanishing — will take whatever they can get to stock bare shelves. Some also offer help with health care and job training. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/22/529493413/in-some-rural-counties-hunger-is-rising-but-food-donations-arent

item.title: As GOP Tarries On Health Bill, Funding For Children's Health Languishes
item.description: May 22, 2017 - The delay in coming up with a bill to replace the Affordable Care Act is making it hard for Congress to reauthorize funding for health care for 9 million children through the popular CHIP program.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 22, 2017 - The delay in coming up with a bill to replace the Affordable Care Act is making it hard for Congress to reauthorize funding for health care for 9 million children through the popular CHIP program. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/22/529144353/as-gop-tarries-on-health-bill-funding-for-childrens-health-languishes

item.title: Tips For Staying Healthy When Traveling Abroad
item.description: May 22, 2017 - Two travel tips are often overlooked by clinicians, and can be especially helpful when people are headed to places with less-than-ideal plumbing and sewage systems.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 22, 2017 - Two travel tips are often overlooked by clinicians, and can be especially helpful when people are headed to places with less-than-ideal plumbing and sewage systems. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/22/528802722/tips-for-staying-healthy-when-traveling-abroad

item.title: If Raw Fruits Or Veggies Give You A Tingly Mouth, It's A Real Syndrome
item.description: May 22, 2017 - Pollen allergies can trigger reactions to fruits and vegetables. The condition — known as oral allergy syndrome — can come on suddenly and often goes undiagnosed.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 22, 2017 - Pollen allergies can trigger reactions to fruits and vegetables. The condition — known as oral allergy syndrome — can come on suddenly and often goes undiagnosed. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/22/529151256/if-raw-fruits-or-veggies-give-you-a-tingly-mouth-it-s-a-real-syndrome

item.title: Pediatricians Advise No Fruit Juice Until Kids Are 1
item.description: May 22, 2017 - Older kids should limit the amount of juice they drink too. Whole fruit is better than juice because it contains fiber, which slows the absorption of sugar and fills you up the way juice doesn't.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 22, 2017 - Older kids should limit the amount of juice they drink too. Whole fruit is better than juice because it contains fiber, which slows the absorption of sugar and fills you up the way juice doesn't. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/22/528970924/pediatricians-advise-no-fruit-juice-until-kids-are-1

item.title: Why A Surgeon Taught A Non-Doctor To Do Brain Surgery
item.description: May 21, 2017 - It's not the way things usually go. But at the time, Dr. Dilantha Ellegala felt he had no other options if patients were to get the help they needed.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 21, 2017 - It's not the way things usually go. But at the time, Dr. Dilantha Ellegala felt he had no other options if patients were to get the help they needed. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/21/523969459/why-a-surgeon-taught-a-non-doctor-to-do-brain-surgery

item.title: Why Brain Scientists Are Still Obsessed With The Curious Case Of Phineas Gage
item.description: May 21, 2017 - In 1848, a railroad worker survived an accident that drove a 13-pound iron bar through his head. The injury changed his personality, and our understanding of the brain.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 21, 2017 - In 1848, a railroad worker survived an accident that drove a 13-pound iron bar through his head. The injury changed his personality, and our understanding of the brain. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/21/528966102/why-brain-scientists-are-still-obsessed-with-the-curious-case-of-phineas-gage

item.title: New Laws In The U.K. And EU Further Restrict Tobacco Industry
item.description: May 20, 2017 - An EU directive goes into force today, with new rules regulating the tobacco industry. The U.K. is going further: Cigarettes must now be sold in plain green packaging with graphic health warnings.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 20, 2017 - An EU directive goes into force today, with new rules regulating the tobacco industry. The U.K. is going further: Cigarettes must now be sold in plain green packaging with graphic health warnings. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/05/20/529291384/new-laws-in-the-u-k-and-eu-further-restrict-tobacco-industry

item.title: Scientists One Step Closer To 3-D-Printed Ovaries To Treat Infertility
item.description: May 20, 2017 - Researchers printed gelatin scaffolds into which they placed ovarian tissue, and then implanted the new organs in mice. Three out of seven female mice produced healthy offspring using the technology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 20, 2017 - Researchers printed gelatin scaffolds into which they placed ovarian tissue, and then implanted the new organs in mice. Three out of seven female mice produced healthy offspring using the technology. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/20/528646323/scientists-one-step-closer-to-3-d-printed-ovaries-to-treat-infertility

item.title: Health Care Industry Drives Job Growth At The Expense Of Efficiency
item.description: May 19, 2017 - As the debate over health care continues in Washington, one thing not in dispute is that health care industry employment has been going up steadily over the past decade. In Ohio, health care industry jobs now outnumber those in manufacturing. The jobs are good news to state and local economies, but some analysts also say it's a reflection of the high costs and complexity of health care.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 19, 2017 - As the debate over health care continues in Washington, one thing not in dispute is that health care industry employment has been going up steadily over the past decade. The jobs are good news to state and local economies, but some analysts also say it's a reflection of the high costs and complexity of health care. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/19/529175744/health-care-industry-drives-job-growth-at-the-expense-of-efficiency

item.title: 50 Years Ago, A Network Of Clergy Helped Women Seeking Abortion
item.description: May 19, 2017 - Before Roe v. Wade, a network of clergy helped counsel women seeking abortions and sometimes helped them find abortion providers. Some of them are gathering in New York this weekend to mark the 50th anniversary.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 19, 2017 - Before Roe v. Wade, a network of clergy helped counsel women seeking abortions and sometimes helped them find abortion providers. Some of them are gathering in New York this weekend to mark the 50th anniversary. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/19/529175737/50-years-ago-a-network-of-clergy-helped-women-seeking-abortion
